users.reserved_names: Brimir, Einheriar, Garmr, Hel, Jötunheimr, Nidhogg, Niflheim, Niðavellir, Svartálfaheimr,

terrain.name: mountains
terrain.description: Magnification view, but rough enviroment where only the strongest units will heal.

terrain.name: grassland
terrain.description: Great places for any unit to heal, but with a limited view

terrain.name: swamp
terrain.description: Rough enviroment, where only the strongest units will heal, and with a limited view

terrain.name: hills
terrain.description: Okay view, not the best place heal.

terrain.name: forest
terrain.description: Difficult place to fight, not the best place heal and with limted view.

terrain.name: shallow_water
terrain.description: Passable by land units, but not a place for them to stay.

region.name: Denmark
region.info: The to become kingdom of Denmark

region.name: Bornholm
region.description: In ancient Danish the island Bornholm was named Borghand or Borghund; these names were related to Old Norse borg height and bjarg/berg mountain/rock, as it is an island that rises high from the sea. If you start a fight on Bornholm, then be awear it is not even fight.

region.name: Rungholt
region.description: Rungholt was a wealthy city in Nordfriesland which sank beneath the waves in a storm tide on January 16, 1362.

region.name: Hollingsted
region.description: Hollingsted was a wealthy city placed by the river Treene on the trade rute between the North Sea and Redeby.

region.name: Mors
region.description: The island of Mors is of major important to get a foothold into one of major waterway in the Kingdom of Denmark. Lots of opponents will try to win the control, but it is a pure area with limited resources.

region.name: Noerklit
region.description: A bit of confused map, with people spread all over, which makes it hard to focus on one enemy.

region.name: Gothenburg
region.description: By the year 1000, Lödöse was an important trading town, located between modern-day Oslo and Copenhagen and near the mouth of the Göta river.
